explanation: 'Large' is the only word without the diphthong as indicated in the word 'gold'

text:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider MOST APPROPRIATE for each sentence

Nwanze enjoys taking people foraride. This means that Nwanze enjoys

options.D: giving people a ride in his car

text:
From the list of words or group of words lettered A to E, choose the one that is MOST NEARLY OPPOSITE in meaning to the underlined word or group of words and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentence.

The police officer averted that his rifle went off but his victim insisted that he acted deliberately.

From the options lettered A to E, choose the one that BEST COMPLETES each of the following sentences.

We had better make_______ what is available

From the words lettered A to E, choose the one that BEST COMPLETES each of the following sentences.

I crave your .......... to formally introduce the compere for this august gathering.
explanation: The phrase"crave your indulgence"is a formal and polite way to ask for patience, tolerance, or permission, especially in public speaking or formal gatherings. It is commonly used when requesting the audience's attention before proceeding with something.

A. beast→ /iː/B. check→ /e/C. pretty→ /ɪ/D. seek→ /iː/E. seize→ /iː/

text:
Choose from the options lettered A - E the one that has the correct stress with the word given. In each word only one syllable has the main/primary stress and the syllable is written in capital letters

IMAGINATION
explanation:
i-ma-gi-NA-tion
Words ending with ''tion are stressed on the syllable before the ''tion''

text:

The boy______________ his father in all things.

Choose from the options lettered A - E the one that has a different stress pattern from the other four.


A. impound
B. logic
C. piper
D. table
E. true
explanation: Impound is stress on the second syllable while the other options are stressed on the first syllable.

From the list of words or group of words tettered A to E, choose the one that is MOST NEARLY OPPOSITE in meaning to the underlined word or group of words and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentence.

Although Onyinye always discusses freely with her peers, she talks about her private life ___________.
explanation: "Always" means something happens all the time or frequently. The opposite of this would be "seldom," which means it happens rarely or infrequently.
